website_summaries.verdict: For those with eczema, psoriasis, and other skin conditions, this hypoallergenic Tide formula is gentle on the skin.
pros: Tested by dermatologists and doesn't contain harsh ingredients like dyes or strong fragrances
Pods are easy to use and feature ingredients that cleanse, fight stains, and brighten clothes
cons: Multiple users had issues with pods not dissolving in washer

website_summaries.verdict: Tide has offered its superior cleaning product in an allergy friendly pod.
pros: Pre-measured pods make it easy and less messy
Works well on all clothing for the family, not just baby clothes
Tide can often get clothing clean without spot treatment
Also comes in a regular non-pod liquid
cons: The cost on these pods is much more expensive than comparable pod-based detergents

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated by ruined clothes
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these pods for about a year and hadn't had any problems, but in my last few loads I noticed some clothes had this hard sticky plastic on them when removing them from the washing machine. Ruined a new pair of pants and a couple shirts; I finally figured out it was these pods. So frustrating! I cancelled my Subscribe and Save and won't get these again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Duran

customer_reviews.title: Fake vs Real tide
customer_reviews.text: This is the fake brand. I have used the 96 pods pack before and it worked so well so I thought this is the same but it’s not. See differences in the pod consistency and their stickers. Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.author: BloodOfJesus

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, very disappointing product.
customer_reviews.text: The pods don't always dissolve, even in warm water. I've had only about 60% of them actually work and the rest have made a mess in my washer and on my clothes. Very unhappy with this product and won't buy again. Don't know what I was thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Pods Do Not Dissolve
customer_reviews.text: Bought and loved the first container but the last container is horrible. Not sure what they changed but the pods do not dissolve properly and the detergent/pod shell and up stuck to a few items. If you then dry the item it is now ruined (yes, followed directions). I tossed the almost full container. Will not be getting this again!
customer_reviews.author: damit

customer_reviews.title: Update: horrible smell
customer_reviews.text: Update: I’m not sure if these go back and stop working or what. Now, every load I wash with these pods come out of the dryer with a horrible sour smell like stinky gym clothes that sat in a gym bag for a week. I’ll just be using Dreft for all my clothes instead of these and throw out the rest. I bought these because my skin is very sensitive and prone to contact dermatitis from just about anything. These have been great. They leave my clothes clean and fragrance free, and I’ve had no skin issues.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Meek

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE to BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I was concerned because when i went to return it, I was told I couldn't. That was upsetting so I email customer service. They responded within 12 hrs and had the replacement at my front door within 24 hours. Not bad at all. And I checked, every pod is intact this time. Previous review: Every single pod arrived exploded inside the container. Can't return. Guess I'm out the money...
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S

customer_reviews.title: Plastic from pods ruines clothes
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever will totally ruin your clothes! Whatever plastic the pods are made from doesn’t dissolve and sticks to your clothes and gardens again. Has ruined multiple articles of clothing. The pods are not any easier than liquid detergent and you’ll never have to worry about getting plastic stuck to your clothes. Total marketing scheme!
customer_reviews.author: Alex schatzberg

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The scent/dye free Tide Pods work great. I have not had any trouble with them being able to dissolve as I see some other reviews have said. Mine dissolve completely every time and I also have not had any of the plastic problems (left behind as residue on clothes) as stated in a few other reviews. I've ordered the 81 count container twice now from Amazon and they arrived quickly and intact in a box with packing to cushion. It is easy to use them in the wash as I just throw one in with the load (two if its a larger load). Load comes out clean with no perfumes.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kiesler

customer_reviews.title: Worst detergent I've used!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the Tide normal free & gentle liquid, but loved the idea of using the pods for ease of use. However these don't wash the clothes at all. They don't get rid of any marks and still leave deodorant smells, as if the clothes have never been washed, which I've never experienced with any detergents I've tried before. I tried putting extra pods in, but it didn't make a difference. I don't recommend you try this detergent at all.
customer_reviews.author: MissSparkle1980

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive -- shrank product by over 1/2 pound and charging the same
customer_reviews.text: I have this set up on recurring delivery and noticed this month that something seemed different between the two containers. Then I realized they they reduced the amount of product in the packaging while still charging the exact same amount. Product shrinkage is a real issue in food products is an issue and it seems Tide is hopping on that profit gaining bandwagon.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Skin irritation
customer_reviews.text: I didnt notice any issues with the pods and washing clothing but something in this line was irritating sensitive areas of my skin. I got unusual heat rashes just in those areas like under the breast and my c section scar. I rewashed all my clothing that touches those areas with my usual "normal" tide pods and the rashes went away. No idea what was triggering the rash but it was definitely something in the pod!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Good For Small Hands-Don't Dissolve Properly
customer_reviews.text: They should label this container "For Women With Small Hands Only" I can't get either one of my hands into the container to retrieve a pod. I'm not a large man. I'm only 5' 9", 140 pounds with normal sized hands. Also, these pods don't dissolve properly. Don't waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sichuan

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Tide!
customer_reviews.text: Good price, good product. These pods leave very little sent, work well, and do not irritate my skin or nose. I do suggest calculating for 3 with a large load in a non HE washer. Hands down, a good product for those sensitive to smells or more traditional detergent formulations. There are even more gentle products out there, but not at this price, and most not as effective at cleaning. Halfway through first carton and quality seems consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Sivant

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive skin friendly and effective
customer_reviews.text: Pods are a fantastic invention. They're mess-free and easy to use the correct amount every time. I like using these on my toddler's clothing since he has sensitive skin and these clean all the dirt and grime that come from days spent digging in the dirt outside. There's no scent and my child has never reacted to the detergent. I find that these will wash out things like ketchup completely. But, when my kid's socks get literally coated in dirt, those socks tend to stay dingy (which is to be expected.) In all, they exceed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Messy shipment. Requesting return.
customer_reviews.text: Although the outside package seems undamaged, the Tide Pods container is covered in what I assume is the contents of the pods themselves. All of the pods are sticky, and I didn't want to get in there to find out how many were broken or pierced. I bought these because I wanted to avoid a mess, but a mess is what I've actually received.
customer_reviews.author: JudithTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Minimize the Mess and Hassle of Doing the Laundry...
customer_reviews.text: I really love the concept, here. Clean and easy, these little gems make laundry a lot more approachable. If you're still doing your laundry in a Coleman cooler, however, this might not be your best alternative. But if you've been introduced to the mechanized world, and have a REAL washing machine tucked away in some corner of your domicyle, or even visit the local 24hr laundromat (Pssst, hey, buddy, wanna buy some combustibles?), you're gonna love the simplicity of pre-measured 'pods'. I like 'em, too, but still avoid the crowds and employ the Coleman on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: roboscratchTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great product for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for months now. Decided to wait to review based on other reviews to make sure i could review properly. Not sure how every one else is washing their clothes but i have never had an issue with these pods. I place them in my top load lg first and then put clothes on top. I have put 2 king sized blankets in or huge clothes loads. They have never dissolved funny on my clothes. Even if they did, simple just rewash them. My clothes are clean and this seems to be better with our kids skin.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Like the Tide, hate the pods
customer_reviews.text: so the Tide F&G works really well for me, and I got these pods because they were deeply discounted. Then I started noticing little pieces of what looked like plastic all over my clothes when I pulled them out of the dryer. Ruined like tons of clothes before I finally realized it was pieces of the tide pods not washing off, sticking to the clothes then getting dried onto them so it's like melted plastic. I figured maybe it was just my washing machine but I just switched machines and still have this problem. 2 stars just for the Tide product in general but the pods definitely don't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne Richard

customer_reviews.title: Gentle on my skin and makes whites look really bright!
customer_reviews.text: I've done 2 loads of laundry with these pods so far. I wanted to try this because I think I was having an allergic reaction to my old detergent and I already see a difference since switching to this! The scent is really mild and fresh. I can do a huge load of laundry with one pod. Bonus which I wasn't expecting, is that it makes my whites look really bright!
customer_reviews.author: Sarina M.

customer_reviews.title: “Great Pods”
customer_reviews.text: Oh yes ... thank you Tide Company! You’ve been around for a very long while, my mom used Tide when I was a wee one, and liked it much, but I do remember it would, at times, clump!if our water was not hot enough to dissolve powder BUT just know she would love easy dissolving pods; but NOW I KNOW SHE WOULD;75 Yrs., later! They’re the best!! Good job TIDE!👍
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: THERE ARE BETTER OPTIONS
customer_reviews.text: It's not so much that these pods are bad. It's more that they're not good. For one thing, it's better to be able to measure how much detergent you actually want in your load, rather than just tossing in one or two pods, guessing as you go. Ultimately, I switched to the liquid version then switched even faster to Seventh Generation Free and Clear, which I've been using for several years now with excellent results. These pods are probably best use by those new to doing laundry and college students, synonyms, I know.
customer_reviews.author: DisneyDenizen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: My entire family has sensitive skin by my 6 year old has a double whammy with severe eczema. This is the only detergent we can use without causing a flair up. I swear by it for sensitive skin. We have tried every free and clear product that we've come by and this surpasses them all by far. Itncleans very well,no stains left behind. I also like that there is no strange scent. I've found that many free and clear detergents leave an odd scent behind. This is a must for our family.
customer_reviews.author: Savanah

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies
customer_reviews.text: I love the pods because they are so easy to use! I have the Gain pods for my clothes but when we had a baby, I knew I couldn’t use the Gain pods for his clothes, so we got these! They work well, he hasn’t had any issues with them irritating his skin, and he has sensitive skin. The only thing that sucks about using these is that there’s no scent, so you don’t get that fresh clean feel when you’re doing baby laundry, but that’s kind of the point with these. They clean all his items really well!
customer_reviews.author: Mel KTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Works just like the normal pods
customer_reviews.text: Was worried about reviews mentioning plastic debris in clothes. Have not had an issue. I've not noticed that my skin is irritated by my clothes anymore after switching. Seems to be working there!
customer_reviews.author: nimbice

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Film left behind on clothes
customer_reviews.text: The pods don't dissolve all of the way. There is always a plastic film on one or more items of clothing. I have to rewash.
customer_reviews.author: Trumpet Player

customer_reviews.title: Using this to wash our baby clothes
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for our baby stuff since she was born in December. She did have few issues with her skin breaking out but not sure if this had anything to do with it as there are too many factors that can contribute to it. It seems like this is doing what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - Recyclable Container (1)
customer_reviews.text: I always thought pods were dumb, especially with the warning around kids eating them. I like Tide and wanted a product to use that didn't have fragrance. It does the job. Clothes are clean, most stains go away. I like using Seventh Heaven detergent, which I have been buying as well, but recently, I have been trying to decrease the amount of plastic (and unrecyclable plastic) we purchase. The container of pods is a 1, which is recyclable in my town. That is a big plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Patel

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Laundry Detergent in the World
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite laundry detergent in the world - great scent (or really lack thereof) and you know that no one will react to it. I was skeptical of the Pods at first, but I was finally so tired of detergent dripping down the sides of the bottle that I decided to try the Pods. They don't make a mess and they're easy to use. Also, if you have an incompetent person doing laundry, it is so much easier to tell them the number of pods to put in the load than try to explain how to measure out the appropriate amount of liquid...Just make sure that your hands are completely dry when handling the Pods.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Sent free is wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a set free product on my clothes for over two decades and I'm so happy now that there are so many wonderful brands to choose from when you have a sensitive skin issue and don't want a fragrance. When I saw that I could get Tide pods for sensitive skin and fragrance-free I was thrilled and they did not disappoint they've been doing a wonderful job on my clothes and with subscribe and save I've been saving a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: Gina A. Marandino

customer_reviews.title: Even Great In Cold Water
customer_reviews.text: My machine? was not made for Pods so I had a little trouble at first but once I got it working, it was great. The free and gentle even worked great in cold water, and removed stains from laundry my husband did, and he does not pretreat stains, I have psoriasis so I have very sensitive skin and this detergent does not aggravate it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rachal Vermillion-Salsbury

customer_reviews.title: Not worth dealing with undissolved pods
customer_reviews.text: Recently gave these a trial test as we are washing everything in our house (to get rid of moths). Pods regularly (maybe every third load or so) do not dissolve, requiring me to run whatever piece they glued themselves to through the washer again. If you don't notice and go ahead and dry the clothes, they turn into a sticky glue. Not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: These are no doubt very convenient. They were delivered with no problems and I washed a load of laundry immediately. No problems with the pods dissolving since we have a top loading HE washer and the pods went in first. However, I feel like the Tide free and gentle liquid as a pre-treatment for stains worked better for my husbands sweat stains on t-shirts. Other than that, I really enjoyed using these.
customer_reviews.author: Katlyn Mabry

customer_reviews.title: Damaged package
customer_reviews.text: Opened package and some of the tide pods were out of container. Very unhappy. Never had this problem before.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Tide Pods
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the pods for some time now and occasionally have found that the pods do not dissolve properly and will stick to several items of clothing in a particular batch; thus, having to re-launder those items and, at times, go through several more washings to get the residue entirely removed. This can be frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Up in the Northwoods

customer_reviews.title: Good product. No returns no matter what.
customer_reviews.text: I love these PODs because my husband and son have terribly sensitive skin and it still gets our clothes clean. We live overseas (military) so we have to have them shipped to us (our commissary doesn't carry them). Our most recent subscribe and save shipment came destroyed. Almost all the PODS in the tub had burst. When I tried to return the item I learned you can't return them no matter what. So we are stuck trying to find a new option. $20 wasted. Will not be getting shipped to our address again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H.

customer_reviews.title: Did not Clean tough stains.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these every wash. I love that it is more gentle and I like the idea but I have a 9 and 8 year old boy. These just don't get their clothes as clean as I need them to be. They are constantly staining their clothes and the regular Tide pods just work better for me. I will not be repurchasing these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lakesha Ellard

customer_reviews.title: Strong balance of sensitivity and cleaning power
customer_reviews.text: I have very sensitive skin and I will get bad hives if my bed sheets aren't washed with sensitive detergents. This detergent has provided pretty good results. I have had a few VERY small hives after a single washing. This is good, as I usually run an additional cycle with no detergent before I use my sheets. This detergent has also provided a much brighter and cleaner result than other sensitive skin detergents. Overall, the balance of cleaning power and sensitivity has lead me to use this product as my primary choice.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Oily smell and residue on clothing
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed....this product left my clothes smelling like oily rags and with a slick feel...in hot and cold water. I thought, maybe it's my machine, so I ran a cleaning cycle with vinegar and then did a load of sheets in hot water using another no-scent product. The clothes smelled clean and fresh with no residue feel. Going to attempt to return this large container of pods.
customer_reviews.author: V. Corkren

customer_reviews.title: For some reason, this particular pod does not dissolve ...
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, this particular pod does not dissolve properly. I have had issues with the pod partially dissolving and then having residue on my laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: good stuff for lazy husbands who don't want to measure.
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. Something similar came with my new washer and the convenience sold me and the savings from subscribe and save sealed the deal. I usually use 2 for most normal sized loads. Small loads for my little guy just one. If a big load or it is messy than I will use 3 of the pods.
customer_reviews.author: Tyr Na Nog

customer_reviews.title: Great for Sensitive Skin, No Mess
customer_reviews.text: Our current laundry set up makes a constant mess if trying to use powder detergent, so we switched to these pods for the tidy convenience, and it works for the whole family. Use 1 pod for a small load, use 3 pods for a large load. And we find the Free and Clear alleviates any skin sensitive issues, so no one in the family is complaining of allergies from detergent.
customer_reviews.author: Becky S.

customer_reviews.title: Pods dont dissolve fully in side loader machines, ruins clothes
customer_reviews.text: Pods aren't dissolving fully in side loader machines. The pods have ruined many pieces of clothes as they act like a glue that gets all over the clothes. Terribly disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.author: Critical

customer_reviews.title: Good detergent but pods aren't the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Pods don't always break down in the wash and has ruined some of our clothes. I will try the liquid though!
customer_reviews.author: Gina M.

customer_reviews.title: Cured my dog’s constant scratching!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is very allergic to purfumes and scented oils. He is especially sensitive to D-Limonene, which is basically citrus oil. After trying “all natural” detergents, we realized he was only getting worse and scratching more. I switched to these pods which are full of chemicals, but none of the “natural” purfumes or oils. All his scratching and hives are gone and I’m so thankful for this product. I will continue to buy these for life!
customer_reviews.author: Silver Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Don't get Water in the Container :)
customer_reviews.text: For the love of all things good and beautiful about this life, do NOT get water in the container. They stick together and make your life a living hell because you are too broke to justify tossing them out so you will continue to try prying them apart and while stressing your skin out with the harsh detergent which will inevitably get everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: NOYB

customer_reviews.title: Gentle
customer_reviews.text: The only detergent that works for our sensitive family. No scent which is perfect for us but means that you can smell your wet clothes which is kind of weird I guess bc there’s no masking fresh scent. We are allergic to a lot of scents though so it’s good for us but I don’t think you would like it if you like a fresh laundry scent!
customer_reviews.author: Lauryn

customer_reviews.title: RESIDUE
customer_reviews.text: Leaves a plastic residue on clothing during wash. Has ruined 5 pieces of clothing for me so far. Stopped using and threw out.
customer_reviews.author: Amy McKinney

customer_reviews.title: I will never buy this product again. It numerous ...
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy this product again. It numerous loads of my laundry, I would have one or more articles of clothing with the undisolved packet left stuck/melted on. I would have to let apart the fabric stuck my this this, stain treat and wash again. Sometimes the rewash worked to remove this but other times not very well. Big thumbs down!
customer_reviews.author: Casey J. Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Will not dissolve completely in wash...
customer_reviews.text: Great price ... however this is the first pod i have ever purchased that has not completely dissolved in my washer ... i have tried all kinds of brands before from the cheapest to most expensive and this is the only ones i have ever had an issue with ... what a let down :\
customer_reviews.author: 828Jeddy

customer_reviews.title: Good for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: I have very sensitive skin, that causes my back to break out super easily. Since switching to these from the regular pods, I’ve noticed a difference! The scent is also more mild which I prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Geitner

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't always disolve
customer_reviews.text: Recently we keep finding wads of undissolved pods stuck to clothes. It will come out with warm/hot water, but it is no fun worrying if you have soap stuck in your clothes. Switching to something else.
customer_reviews.author: vueng90

customer_reviews.title: These things are great
customer_reviews.text: These things are delicious! I’m kidding. Hopefully. But really, these are great for my laundry. I hate heavily scented laundry soap and these actually clean my sweaty workout clothes and dirty dog beds without just covering up the smell. I like the convenience of the pods over the liquid variety. I don’t know why. But I’ll definitely be buying these until they come out with something more convenient and/or delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Tarah

customer_reviews.title: Works great! The only laundry detergent pods I'll ever use!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They do a good job of cleaning clothes and no weird smells or skin irritation.. I would highly encourage democrats to eat more of these for proper nutritional balance.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Been using for years
customer_reviews.text: I always get this when it’s on sale because it works great for my sensitive skin and will be great to use for my baby clothes. Works great and leaves the clothes smelling fresh. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Original Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Ruined clothing
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. I threw in new fall clothes for my kids in the wash and several pants came out with white stains from the pods not dissolving correctly. A new bin of tide pods all in the trash. I do not recommend these and cancelled my subscription with Amazon. I will be looking for another brand replacement.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works well with people with allergies
customer_reviews.text: Love how easy these are to use. Just throw them in the wash and they’re good to go. These are great because you can wash a lot of loads. It’s also great for allergic reactions to perfumes. It’s cleans Stains and leaves my clothes clean and fresh!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Issues with dissolving in cold water
customer_reviews.text: I like these, but sometimes they do not completely dissolve in cold water. Great in warm, but sometimes washing delicates the gel does not dissolve and ends up clinging to the clothes.
customer_reviews.author: SLH61956

customer_reviews.title: Neatest washing detergent that ever was packaged...no dry powder mess!
customer_reviews.text: Not only are these Tide pod thing-a-majiggs easy and neat to handle, they really wash the "cow lot" out of my blue jeans. Easy on the Misse's skin too. Note to you "youngens": Don't try to eat 'em they ain't ketchup packets!
customer_reviews.author: Texas50BMG

customer_reviews.title: Unscented?
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars...Is it supposed to have a smell, it says unscented so I'm confused because it smells weird. The smell is not that bad, but still it smells weird, can't describe it that much it's like a musty but clean smell lol maybe it will go away when the clothes are dried? Hopefully I'll let you know. Update 5 stars: Okay the clothes are dried now and the smell is gone, thank goodness
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Monitor the container
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, I would give a ZERO. For the last three orders, middle way thru the end of the container, the pods are stuck together and leaking. I made sure it was not the way they were stored in my closet. THEY CAME THIS WAY. Please, if my next upcoming order is like this, I will stop buying them from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: PACO

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t want to love them but I do!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want to like these but I do. I actually love them. Didn’t want to like because more expensive Love because ease of use, seem to go further/do more loads than liquid ( pre measured helps a bunch) scent is great
customer_reviews.author: Brenda G. Edmonson

customer_reviews.title: Love the convenience: no measuring hassle and no mess.
customer_reviews.text: Forget having to measure the amount of detergent you need, just use the number of pouches based on the size and "dirtiness" of whatever you're washing. Sometimes the pouch leaves residue on black clothing, but if you put the pouches in first and start the water, then put in the laundry, it's not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the container this is in - the shape is awkward, takes up too much room, and the lid is difficult to open/close even though it feels flimsy. The product itself though is fine - I only buy free and clear detergents either this brand or its competitor. It works!
customer_reviews.author: Viv

customer_reviews.title: Instant superglue for my laundry
customer_reviews.text: Turns to superglue in the washer, and ruins your clothes. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Morticia

customer_reviews.title: Donation
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to the Optimist for Ronald McDonald house. So that clubs could put together washing products for the families that stay there. In a snack bag, a pod, a dryer sheet and family has washing Material.
customer_reviews.author: CRS

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive skin approved
customer_reviews.text: Since myself and son suffer from eczema I only use this detergent for our clothes. Two pods to get the extra clean on our clothes as well. Definitely reccomended product for anyone with sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.author: Lama Mama

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The plastic on the pod ruined my comforters and some of my clothes!
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Gelene R. Grice

customer_reviews.title: So the Free and Gently certainly works better for me
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Tide for a long time now, and pods for about as long as they have been out. I tend to get itchy skin from some laundry detergents. So the Free and Gently certainly works better for me. I actually prefer them as they don't have the heavy fragrance as other pods including the original Tide pods.
customer_reviews.author: Tom HightowerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IF YOU OWN ANY DARK COLORED COLTHING!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I thought no dyes = better for colored clothes. I made sure to run my laundry in cold wash to be extra safe. WRONG! My blue/grey colored clothes and bedsheets have come out blanched/bleached in spotty form. Other dark colored items have uniformly faded as well. I've ruined at least $100 worth of fabrics over the last month. I strongly suspect a bleaching/whitening agent in this detergent - DO NOT BUY IF YOU OWN ANY DARK COLORED COLTHING. YOU WILL RUIN THEM AND THEY WILL LOSE COLOR.
customer_reviews.author: Hoon Kim

customer_reviews.title: So convenient!
customer_reviews.text: So glad to have the Free & Gentle--we get these on Amazon Pantry subscription. They work well--clothes are clean, pods always fully dissolve. Easy to recommend. Our basement is humid, so I keep the top latched. A few have been stuck together (it's rare)--I pull them apart and try to use each one ASAP, as they do leak if pulling them apart caused a small hole.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mama

customer_reviews.title: Easy, gentle, simple.
customer_reviews.text: These little, white, jiggly packets look like if they had a flavor they’d taste like marshmallows - they don’t. Do not eat laundry detergent. Do not use laundry detergent as a trampoline, as a parachute, or as bear repellent. They’re for washing your clothes, that’s it. For their intended purpose, they’re quite good. Laundry gets clean and isn’t impregnated with perfumes or allergens.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient to use, but way too many suds ...
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient to use, but way too many suds. They say HE (for High Efficiency washers) but there's still suds after five washings and I had to stop using these in my front loading machine and go back to the Tide Free & Gentle liquid detergent.
customer_reviews.author: SG in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Free & gentle, but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews for something as mundane as laundry soap, but I thought it was worth saying that these get the job done. Even though it's "free and gentle." I have a toddler girl who stains just about everything with various foods. My SO is always commenting on how I manage to get her clothes clean and complains that his socks never look as white as what hers do (or her other white clothes). I do use a stain remover for tough, set-in stains but for most loads, I just use this and we like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very hypoallergenic
customer_reviews.text: I have problems with detergents giving me hives or making me sneeze a lot but this was not the case with these Tide pods. They are easy to use and didn’t Leave an odor on my clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Only Detergent I Use
customer_reviews.text: Since I started using these a year or so ago, they are the only detergent I use on my clothes now. I love the convenience of not having to measure or worry about adding water to the detergent area of my front-loading washing machine. As others have noted, it is very important you add the pod in before the clothes. As for the extra rinse-cycle issue, I can't comment on if that helps or not because I have ALWAYS done an extra rinse cycle since I like to be extra sure all the detergent is washed out well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: TIDE-al Waves of Disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: What has happened to our Tide products?! These glue-y, goo-ey, residue-y pods are a clothes-staining, time-wasting, money-costing mistake. We buy our laundry products to help us remove spots and stains, not create them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need more than what it says on container
customer_reviews.text: This product works pretty well however I always use an additional one compared to what is on the package because I noticed odor lingering around if I just used what the package says.
customer_reviews.author: ch123455654

customer_reviews.title: Prevents skin irritation.
customer_reviews.text: Life saver for my sensitive skin. After trying endless detergents, this is the best I have found prevent skin irritation. Additionally, it leaves no residue and is easy to use-just throw it in with your load.
customer_reviews.author: Lizbot

customer_reviews.title: No more sticky hands
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan. I like that I don't need to use a cup to measure out how much liquid to use, then end up with sticky hands and having to put the sticky cover back on. Tide always seems to get my clothes clean the way other brands don't. I switched to Free & Gentle with the baby in the house. I rated this 4/5 because there's no scent on this one, but I guess that's how Free & Gentle goes.
customer_reviews.author: bianca_r

customer_reviews.title: I love this so much!
customer_reviews.text: I have always been using the HE Detergent Pods by Tide before, but ever since I tried the Tide Free and Gentle Laundry Detergent pods, I never switched. There's not really any scent in these pods, but I recommend to combine the pods with "Downy Unstoppables in-Wash Scent Boosters" to boost the scent. Remember to throw a couple/few pods depending on the load FIRST before putting your clothes in the washer. I have done the opposite and it didn't go well. Overall, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, you bet!
customer_reviews.text: Tide Free and Gentle Laundry Detergent Pods are--surprisingly--easy to use! But the scent could be less noticeable and they could be cheaper? Its detergent, not rare 17th century balsamic vinegar.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton White

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for allergy/asthma suffers
customer_reviews.text: I have allergy induced asthma and strong scents from laundry detergent is always a trigger for me. I’ve been using this product for years and have never had a flare up because of it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This definitely costs more than normal liquid soap but is far more clean and convenient to use than the standard liquid soap.
customer_reviews.author: Boof

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use & great for anyone suffering from asthma or allergies - no scent whatsoever & we've had no skin irritations. Keep away from small children. Makes doing laundry especially easy as there is no measuring or using too much detergent - look for sales & coupons to keep the price in check. Would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: SLB

customer_reviews.title: This works well for our sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: This works better than the other brand we tried for the sensitive skin. The other brand was aggravating eczema. This is our monthly go to.
customer_reviews.author: texanatheart

customer_reviews.title: Stuck together and leaking
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the container, the pods were stuck together and leaking. What a mess. I've been trying to cut them apart, but it has not been going well. I assume they've been somewhere where the temperature was too high and they melted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I want the more natural product without scent and for my sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: This does the job and comes in 81 pods. This is also aligned with the market in terms of price. What else?
customer_reviews.author: PJL

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: We are allergic to Tide in my household but since it's Free and Gentle....I thought we'd try it. Works perfectly for us. Super excited. We've completely switched from All to Tide Free and Gentle.
customer_reviews.author: Tearra Nay

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin and love the child proof packaging!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. So easy to toss into the washer. The lid is difficult/next-to-impossible to open for a child, which is a plus. I have not had any issues with left-over residue on clothes. For those with sensitive skin: the regular (scented) tide pods gave my husband an allergic reaction, but these free and gentle ones have been just fine.
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: Most of the pods came stuck to each other
customer_reviews.text: First time I buy Tide pods in Amazon. Not happy. Most of the pods came stuck to each other so when you need just to use one you had 4 or 5 of them of glued together. Impossible to separate them without getting all the detergent in your hands during the process. What a mess!
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Tide pods melt every time
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how these people have ever had problems with Tide pods. We have used them for several years with no issues. Yep, we wash at every temperature from cold to hot with no sticky residue or unmelted pods. We have used them in an He machine as well as in a machine with an agitator. The pods get thrown in at any time, all without fail. I would question something else.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Works OK. Make sure it goes in the bottom of the washer, w/ clothes on top, as plastic enclosing the "pod" can stick to clothes
customer_reviews.text: Works OK. Make sure it goes in the bottom of the washer, with your clothes on top, as the plastic that encloses the pod can sit on and stick to your clothes
customer_reviews.author: L. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: I found that AMAZON has the best price on the larger sized tub and if you ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about TIDE! They may be pricier than most detergent brands but I did the numbers and brake down on pricing and it's worth the extra bucks. I don't have to use as much spot treater because TIDE does it's job. Plus, I found that AMAZON has the best price on the larger sized tub and if you subscribe you save more too.... So, that is what I've been doing and it's been wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: P. Switzer

customer_reviews.title: Does not dissolve
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what’s going on but lately the pods have not been dissolving and the outer plastic layer sticks to ur clothes and when dried the plastic becomes super hard and almost impossible to remove. It will dissolve under running hot water but does not removes all the way and on some fabrics it totally ruined it. Super annoyed!
customer_reviews.author: lovealways

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I have had trouble with skin sensitivity with Heather products but this has giving me no trouble. It cleans well and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Detergent
customer_reviews.text: As I have aged my skin has become more sensitive. So this works wonders for me. I have switch over to these pods for all my laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Jenita M

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I love this product because I don’t like my laundry to have a clean scent. To me, it comes out smelling clean but not like fresh laundry. I have sensitive skin as well and it never reacts bad to my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Micheleeeeeee

customer_reviews.title: Melted, together,  not separate
customer_reviews.text: The pods are all melted together-- in clusters. This is a photo of one cluster where they are all attached together and when you try to remove one, they all break apart. One big mess!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Castrinos

customer_reviews.title: I’m not positive these are even cleaning the clothes. ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m not positive these are even cleaning the clothes. I don’t see soap bubbles and clothes don’t smell clean after. I’ve been doing two cycles per load and extra pods just to be sure.
customer_reviews.author: clarkmp

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for baby clothes
customer_reviews.text: Pods don’t dissolve well and sticks to clothes - other pods worked better
customer_reviews.author: RP

product_meta.title: Tide Free and Gentle Laundry Detergent Pods, 81 Count, Unscented and Hypoallergenic for Sensitive Skin
product_meta.description:
Taking care of sensitive skin doesn’t have to be hard. Each individual pac of Tide PODS Free & Gentle HE Turbo laundry detergent cleans, fights stains, brightens fabrics and is specially designed free of dyes and perfumes. Simply put in one pac for most loads, but use two pacs for large loads and three pacs for extra-large loads. For a simple, worry-free laundry experience that’s gentle on skin, Tide PODS Free & Gentle laundry detergent will keep your family looking and feeling great. It outperformed the leading free detergent on 10 different stains.*

BRAND STORY
By Tide
feature_bullets: Hypoallergenic. Dermatologist Tested. Free of dyes and perfumes
3-in-1 laundry pacs: detergent, stain remover, brightener
Each pac of Tide Pods Free & Gentle provides a deeper clean (versus the leading Free detergent) that’s gentle on skin
1 laundry pac for medium loads, 2 pacs for large loads and 3 pacs for extra large loads
Tide PODS laundry pacs dissolve quickly in hot & cold

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
